titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the South Side Signal vital records 1978.184
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:12:48 +0000.

did.abstract: The collection contains birth, marriage, and death records spanning the period 1869 to 1877. The records are typewritten and were originally published in the South Side Signal, a publication from Babylon, Long Island, N.Y.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); South Side Signal vital records, 1978.184, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The records were formally accessioned in 1978.

controlaccess.subject: Vital statistics -- New York (State) -- Long Island
controlaccess.title: South side signal
